result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Louise Searles

records.addlTxt: from Racine County Alternatives Program - Incident Report
Verification required by SPD.
Emailed dispatch @ 11:22 a.m. to cancel warrant.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Do not drive at all.

10:10 AM Defendant Louise Searles in court.  Prosecuting attorney Patricia Hanson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defendant does not have an attorney yet. 
Defendant is still trying to retain a Lawyer.
BTC: Vacate Warrant
Status conference scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
